alert.note: Alert for Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 9:33AM EDT until further notice by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Vermilion River Near Vermilion affecting Lorain and Erie Counties. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Vermilion River...including Vermilion...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Elyria. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EDT Thursday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.1 feet on 01/19/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EDT.
